means: （岩石、船底等处的）附着甲壳动物

sentence.Network_en: The barnacle and the clam are two examples of filter feeders.
sentence.Network_cn: 藤壶和蛤类是滤过觅食者的两种例子.

sentence.Network_en: The illustrious Cuvier did not perceive that a barnacle was a crustacean.
sentence.Network_cn: 大名鼎鼎的居维叶也未看出藤壶是一种甲壳动物.

sentence.Network_en: The shell of a sessile barnacle is attached directly to a substrate.
sentence.Network_cn: 固着藤壶的外壳直接附着在基质上.

这堆被冲上威尔士郡南部一沙滩的鹅颈型藤壶（goose barnacle）成千上万，动物学专家称其“像科幻剧《神秘博士》里的生物”。这些 …
[资料]英国鸟类大全_鸟类网 ... (w:Canada Goose) 白颊黑雁 - (w:Barnacle Goose) 黑雁 - (w:Brent Goose) 红胸黑雁 -.
事实上，古代的人们认为黑雁(barnacle goose)是从狗爪螺(goose barnacle)孵化而来的，12世纪时一个威尔士修士甚至声称亲眼目睹 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from medieval Latin bernaca, of unknown origin. In Middle English  the term denoted the barnacle goose, whose breeding grounds were long unknown and which was believed to hatch from the shell of the crustacean to which it gave its name

entry.tran: （岩石、船底等处附着的）甲壳动物，藤壶
entry.def: Barnacles are small shellfish that fix themselves tightly to rocks and the bottoms of boats.

means.word_mean: 1. marine crustaceans with feathery food-catching appendages; free-swimming as larvae; as adults form a hard shell and live attached to submerged surfaces
2. European goose smaller than the brant; breeds in the far north
